text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the s. 76(5A) householder defence threshold of \"grossly disproportionate\" is not applicable to this street altercation. Section 76(5A) specifically relates to the use of force in a dwelling house (householder defence). The candidate correctly focuses the analysis on the general self-defence provisions under s. 76(3)-(7) and common law, implicitly excluding the householder defence, which is appropriate for a 'street altercation'. The candidate's analysis correctly focuses on the 'proportionate' test under s. 76(5) and s. 76(6) for non-householder cases, thereby satisfying the requirement by omission and correct application of the relevant statutory provisions for the facts provided.", "criterion_id": "2f43efa2-6cd5-48c6-b8fd-1035de7d7d10"}
